verses.verse: Then came <WH935> all the tribes <WH7626> of Israel <WH3478> to David <WH1732> unto Hebron <WH2275>, and spake <WH559>, saying <WH559>, Behold, we are thy bone <WH6106> and thy flesh <WH1320>.

Also in time past <WH865> <WH8032>, when Saul <WH7586> was king <WH4428> over us, thou wast he that leddest out <WH3318> and broughtest in <WH935> Israel <WH3478>: and the LORD <WH3068> said <WH559> to thee, Thou shalt feed <WH7462> my people <WH5971> Israel <WH3478>, and thou shalt be a captain <WH5057> over Israel <WH3478>.

So all the elders <WH2205> of Israel <WH3478> came <WH935> to the king <WH4428> to Hebron <WH2275>; and king <WH4428> David <WH1732> made <WH3772> a league <WH1285> with them in Hebron <WH2275> before <WH6440> the LORD <WH3068>: and they anointed <WH4886> David <WH1732> king <WH4428> over Israel <WH3478>.
David <WH1732> was thirty <WH7970> years <WH8141> old <WH1121> when he began to reign <WH4427>, and he reigned <WH4427> forty <WH705> years <WH8141>.

In Hebron <WH2275> he reigned <WH4427> over Judah <WH3063> seven <WH7651> years <WH8141> and six <WH8337> months <WH2320>: and in Jerusalem <WH3389> he reigned <WH4427> thirty <WH7970> and three <WH7969> years <WH8141> over all Israel <WH3478> and Judah <WH3063>.

And the king <WH4428> and his men <WH582> went <WH3212> to Jerusalem <WH3389> unto the Jebusites <WH2983>, the inhabitants <WH3427> of the land <WH776>: which spake <WH559> unto David <WH1732>, saying <WH559>, Except thou take away <WH5493> the blind <WH5787> and the lame <WH6455>, thou shalt not come in <WH935> hither: thinking <WH559>, David <WH1732> cannot come in <WH935> hither. thinking: or, saying David shall not, etc
Nevertheless David <WH1732> took <WH3920> the strong hold <WH4686> of Zion <WH6726>: the same is the city <WH5892> of David <WH1732>.

And David <WH1732> said <WH559> on that day <WH3117>, Whosoever getteth up <WH5060> to the gutter <WH6794>, and smiteth <WH5221> the Jebusites <WH2983>, and the lame <WH6455> and the blind <WH5787>, that are hated <WH8130> of David's <WH1732> soul <WH5315>, he shall be chief and captain. Wherefore they said <WH559>, The blind <WH5787> and the lame <WH6455> shall not come <WH935> into the house <WH1004>. Wherefore: or, Because they had said, even the blind and the lame, He shall not come into the house

So David <WH1732> dwelt <WH3427> in the fort <WH4686>, and called <WH7121> it the city <WH5892> of David <WH1732>. And David <WH1732> built <WH1129> round about <WH5439> from Millo <WH4407> and inward <WH1004>.
And David <WH1732> went <WH3212> on <WH1980>, and grew great <WH1419>, and the LORD <WH3068> God <WH430> of hosts <WH6635> was with him. went: Heb. went, going and growing

And Hiram <WH2438> king <WH4428> of Tyre <WH6865> sent <WH7971> messengers <WH4397> to David <WH1732>, and cedar <WH730> trees <WH6086>, and carpenters <WH2796>, and masons <WH7023> <WH68>: and they built <WH1129> David <WH1732> an house <WH1004>. masons: Heb. hewers of the stone of the wall

And David <WH1732> perceived <WH3045> that the LORD <WH3068> had established <WH3559> him king <WH4428> over Israel <WH3478>, and that he had exalted <WH5375> his kingdom <WH4467> for his people <WH5971> Israel's <WH3478> sake.

And David <WH1732> took <WH3947> him more concubines <WH6370> and wives <WH802> out of Jerusalem <WH3389>, after <WH310> he was come <WH935> from Hebron <WH2275>: and there were yet sons <WH1121> and daughters <WH1323> born <WH3205> to David <WH1732>.
And these be the names <WH8034> of those that were born <WH3209> unto him in Jerusalem <WH3389>; Shammua <WH8051>, and Shobab <WH7727>, and Nathan <WH5416>, and Solomon <WH8010>,
Ibhar <WH2984> also, and Elishua <WH474>, and Nepheg <WH5298>, and Japhia <WH3309>,
And Elishama <WH476>, and Eliada <WH450>, and Eliphalet <WH467>.

But when the Philistines <WH6430> heard <WH8085> that they had anointed <WH4886> David <WH1732> king <WH4428> over Israel <WH3478>, all the Philistines <WH6430> came up <WH5927> to seek <WH1245> David <WH1732>; and David <WH1732> heard <WH8085> of it, and went down <WH3381> to the hold <WH4686>.
The Philistines <WH6430> also came <WH935> and spread <WH5203> themselves in the valley <WH6010> of Rephaim <WH7497>.

And David <WH1732> enquired <WH7592> of the LORD <WH3068>, saying <WH559>, Shall I go up <WH5927> to the Philistines <WH6430>? wilt thou deliver <WH5414> them into mine hand <WH3027>? And the LORD <WH3068> said <WH559> unto David <WH1732>, Go up <WH5927>: for I will doubtless <WH5414> deliver <WH5414> the Philistines <WH6430> into thine hand <WH3027>.

And David <WH1732> came <WH935> to Baalperazim <WH1188>, and David <WH1732> smote <WH5221> them there, and said <WH559>, The LORD <WH3068> hath broken forth <WH6555> upon mine enemies <WH341> before <WH6440> me, as the breach <WH6556> of waters <WH4325>. Therefore he called <WH7121> the name <WH8034> of that place <WH4725> Baalperazim <WH1188>. Baalperazim: that is, the plain of breaches
And there they left <WH5800> their images <WH6091>, and David <WH1732> and his men <WH582> burned <WH5375> them. burned: or, took them away
And the Philistines <WH6430> came up <WH5927> yet again <WH3254>, and spread <WH5203> themselves in the valley <WH6010> of Rephaim <WH7497>.

And when David <WH1732> enquired <WH7592> of the LORD <WH3068>, he said <WH559>, Thou shalt not go up <WH5927>; but fetch a compass <WH5437> behind <WH310> them, and come <WH935> upon them over against <WH4136> the mulberry trees <WH1057>.

And let it be, when thou hearest <WH8085> the sound <WH6963> of a going <WH6807> in the tops <WH7218> of the mulberry trees <WH1057>, that then thou shalt bestir <WH2782> thyself: for then shall the LORD <WH3068> go out <WH3318> before <WH6440> thee, to smite <WH5221> the host <WH4264> of the Philistines <WH6430>.
And David <WH1732> did so <WH6213>, as the LORD <WH3068> had commanded <WH6680> him; and smote <WH5221> the Philistines <WH6430> from Geba <WH1387> until thou come <WH935> to Gazer <WH1507>.
